intro: Heliciopsis artocarpoides, commonly known as the Philippine breadfruit tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and distinctive, compound leaves. The tree produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by fleshy, orange-red fruits that resemble breadfruit. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
